customData.content: 65-year-old man with a history of stage IV non-small cell lung cancer (treated with chemotherapy, without evidence of residual viable malignancy) presented with sore throat and mild pain in the right upper arm. He was treated with nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs for 3 days.

diagnoses.label: Malignant neoplasm of unspecified part of bronchus or lung

HPI.summary: 65-year-old man presented with sore throat and mild pain in the right upper arm.
associated_symptoms: pain in the right upper arm

medications.indication: pain in the right upper arm

customData.content: Mild leukocytosis, C-reactive protein elevated to 14.6 mg/L, creatinine level was 4.0 mg/dL indicating acute azotemia, body temperature was 36.6°C, chest radiography unremarkable, nasal swab confirmed influenza A virus.

During treatment of influenza A with talniflumate, the patient developed a fever of 38.6°C and complained of aggravating pain and weakness in the right upper arm. Intravenous ceftriaxone was started. MRI of the brain revealed no metastatic or ischemic lesions. FDG PET/CT revealed hypermetabolic lesions in the retropharyngeal space with a maximum standardized uptake value (SUVmax) of 9.8, involving the vertebral bodies (VBs) of the C4 and C5 vertebrae and prevertebral spaces of the T1–T4 vertebrae.

imaging.finding: hypermetabolic lesions involving the vertebral bodies (VBs) of the C4 and C5 vertebrae and prevertebral spaces of the T1–T4 vertebrae

HPI.summary: Aggravating pain and weakness in the right upper arm

customData.content: Maximum intensity projection image of positron emission tomography and sagittal scan of positron emission tomography/computed tomography fusion imaging reveal continuous hypermetabolic lesions along the prevertebral and danger spaces of the neck from the C2–T4 levels with associated osteomyelitis of the vertebral bodies of C4 and C5. PET/CT suggested DNI with DNM, combined with osteomyelitis of VBs of C4 and C5, and less likely, bone metastases in VBs of C4 and C5. Contrast-enhanced neck CT revealed localized abscesses with the fluid collection and rim enhancement in the retropharyngeal space and T1-T4 prevertebral space. Klebsiella pneumoniae was isolated in the blood and sputum cultures of the patient.

imaging.finding: continuous hypermetabolic lesions along the prevertebral and danger spaces of the neck from the C2–T4 levels
continuous hypermetabolic lesions along the prevertebral and danger spaces of the neck from the C2–T4 levels with associated osteomyelitis of the vertebral bodies of C4 and C5

imaging.type: Positron emission tomography/computed tomography fusion imaging
imaging.body_part: vertebral bodies of C4 and C5
imaging.impression: DNI with DNM, combined with osteomyelitis of VBs of C4 and C5, and less likely, bone metastases in VBs of C4 and C5.

imaging.type: Localized abscesses with the fluid collection and rim enhancement
imaging.body_part: retropharyngeal space and T1-T4 prevertebral space

data.content: Patient's condition evolved from sore throat and mild right arm pain to exhibiting mild leukocytosis, elevated C-reactive protein, acute azotemia, and confirmed influenza A virus infection.

Patient, while being treated for influenza A with talniflumate, developed a fever and worsening right arm pain/weakness. Ceftriaxone was initiated. Imaging revealed hypermetabolic lesions in the retropharyngeal space and vertebral bodies.

Further imaging and cultures revealed continuous hypermetabolic lesions along the prevertebral and danger spaces of the neck, osteomyelitis of the cervical vertebrae, localized abscesses, and Klebsiella pneumoniae infection in blood and sputum.
